questions.question: 1.  What is the primary goal of virtual reality (VR) technology?

answers.a: To simulate real-world experiences and environments for entertainment and training purposes.
answers.b: To create fully autonomous artificial intelligence.

questions.question: 2.  Which of the following is NOT a component essential for a VR system?
3. What distinguishes virtual reality from augmented reality?

answers.a: Augmented reality overlays digital content onto the real world, while virtual reality immerses users in a completely simulated environment.
answers.b: Virtual reality requires specialized hardware, while augmented reality can be experienced using standard smartphones or tablets.
answers.c: Virtual reality is only used for entertainment purposes, while augmented reality is primarily used for practical applications.
answers.d: Augmented reality is a subset of virtual reality, focusing on enhancing digital experiences within virtual environments.
